Even though most of the #NintendoDirect was boring and unexciting, there were definitely some things to get excited about. Here's a few small ones:

- Free updates to Mario Golf
- New weapons / stages for AoC
- THPS 1&2 Remastered & Updated

In any given #NintendoDirect, I don't care about 80% of what they share, and they KNOW it! That's why their little tagline is, "There's something for everyone on the Nintendo Switch"

Translation: We know 95% of you don't care about this, but 5% people do.

#MarioPartySuperstars seems like a slam dunk for #Nintendo and it was one of the most pleasant surprises from the #NintendoDirect.

Anyone who played MP 1, 2, or 3 will be hyped to relive the magic. That said, I'm worried it will be another $60 for what is basically SMP DLC

I'm really glad #Nintendo will be reviving the #WarioWare franchise. I played the original a bit and liked it but...let's just say it was never a game that was hard for me to put down. Just a fun little game.

Hopefully co-op & updated games make it more dynamic. #NintendoDirect

Okay so I am finally caught up on the #NintendoDirect - why they plan these things during everyone's work day will always be a mystery to me. I have lots of thoughts. 

Overall it was disappointing, but there are things to be excited about.

For my thoughts of the #NintendoDirect , it had more good games than bad games to my opinion.
